meanings.definition: The action of loading a ship or other vessel with cargo.
meanings.sent1: The lading of the ship was completed before it set sail.
meanings.sent2: The sailors worked hard to finish the lading of the vessel.
meanings.sent3: The lading of the ship was so heavy that it almost sank!
meanings.sent4: The lading of responsibilities weighed heavily on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The lading of the ship was a sight to behold, with crates stacked high.

meanings.definition: The cargo carried by a ship or other vessel.
meanings.sent1: The lading on board the ship included valuable goods.
meanings.sent2: The lading was securely stored in the ship's hold.
meanings.sent3: The pirates were after the lading of treasures on the vessel.
meanings.sent4: The lading of memories filled the old sailor's heart.
meanings.sent5: The lading of the ship was carefully inspected before departure.
